abstract: Landsat TM images are coregistered with a Seasat SAR image of the margin of the Greenland ice sheet and used in the interpretation of features in the SAR data. A winter TM image is used to provide topographic information while a summer TM image provides information on the pattern of melt and the location of lakes. It is shown that: (1) the snow line is easily detectable in SAR imagery; (2) areas of higher radar backscatter in the bare-ice zone most often correspond to areas full of crevasses too small to resolve in the SAR images; (3) subsurface scattering causes significant blurring of features in SAR imagery; and (4) the band of surface lakes occurring above the snow line corresponds to at least a portion of the wet-snow zone.
title: Interpretation of SAR imagery of the Greenland ice sheet using coregistered TM imagery
